critique: This document establishes a General Supply Committee to systematize the purchase of supplies across multiple government departments and establishments. It aims to secure lower and uniform prices and more effectively carry out the spirit of the Act of January 27th, 1894. The order outlines the committee's composition, responsibilities, and procedures for purchasing supplies, including preparing schedules, advertising for proposals, and formulating inspection methods. It also directs departments to provide technical assistance and assign employees to the committee as needed. The document does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. It primarily focuses on improving government efficiency and standardization in procurement. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral.
